definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream

sentences.english: They waited for someone to come rescue them from their nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 他们等待有那么一个人能够将他们从恶梦中拯救出来。

sentences.english: Older people seemed to dream less and have fewer nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 老年人的梦仿佛要少一些，也更少做恶梦。

sentences.english: Sometimes at midnight when sudden moment wake up from any bad dream or any, Listen music-think definitely can sleep again (sound sleep).
sentences.chinese: 当夜半忽因恶梦惊醒，听这个音乐就可安然入睡。

sentences.english: The Buttah are normally associated with nightmares, abductions and the taking of small children.
sentences.chinese: 饿鬼通过与恶梦在一起，诱拐和吸引小孩。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, the ragtag crew has nightmarish encounters with skitters and mechs.
sentences.chinese: 同时，乌合之众船员恶梦般的遭遇很快和机甲。

sentences.english: The war years in Yugoslavia were pure hell,” Simic told USINFO in an interview August 9.
sentences.chinese: 南斯拉夫的战争年代全然一场恶梦。

sentences.english: Tonto, after having a very bad dream, woke up to see the stars up above him.
sentences.chinese: 通图做了恶梦，他睁开眼看见许多的星星。

sentences.english: He knew he was asking many to revisit a nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 他知道，他是在请求许多人重温恶梦。

sentences.english: I had a nightmare last night, and lost sleep.
sentences.chinese: 昨夜我作了个恶梦，失眠了。

sentences.english: Yesterday is a day of nightmare to me.
sentences.chinese: 昨天对我来讲，有点像恶梦般的一天。

sentences.english: The ancient seal will be broken, awakening nightmares of ages past.
sentences.chinese: 那古代的封印会被毁坏，唤醒遥远过去的恶梦。

sentences.english: The surprise and shock, rinse and Fang Zhai is staged by dreams and nightmares.
sentences.chinese: 这种惊喜和惊吓，是漱芳斋轮番上演的美梦和恶梦。

sentences.english: This nightmare struck him so forcibly that he wrote it down later on.
sentences.chinese: 那场恶梦狠狠地打击了他，使他后来把它记了下来。

sentences.english: For them, a McMansion is not a dream. It's a nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 对你的邻居们来说，麦克豪宅并非美梦，而是恶梦了。

definition: night demon (malign spirit believed to plague people during sleep)
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
to sleepwalk/to journey in a dream
